Site: Visit to Argentine Socialist Alfredo Palacios
Comment: "I leave with the feeling of having had en exchange with an ancient gentleman. Deep down, I find it har to believe that men of such ideas and such language are capable of taking the masses from the influence of Peronist demagogy. Not only times change, I thought, not only children come of age. Men and ideas also grow older."
"Several leading cadre were waiting for us."
"...an old structure of the beginning of the 20th century, which has never chage its name, not even in the years when they had broken with the Soviets."
"Of its 700 inhabitants, only one does not take part in the cooperative"
"The building was built in times of the Monarchy to be occupied by the Agrarian Bank"

Site: Museum of the War of Liberation in Serbia
Comment: "It lies in the very ancient Roman-Turkish fortress of Kalemegdan"

Site: Museum of the War of Liberation in Slovenia
Comment: "It holds a mural painting that says 'What is someone else's, we do not want; what is ours, we do not give' "
"I remember seeing a sculpture by Vanja Radaus called 'The Executioner'".
"In the doors, a sign says 'Comrade Tito was born here'. Nothing else. Not a sign of the tropical exuberance of a Trujillo, or a Somoza"
"A conmemorative sign shows that the workers, by suggestion of Tito and the SKJ, realized Marx and Engels' ideas and took over the factory on October 20, 1950"
"In the factory, the minimum wage is 7,500 dinars, while directors have a wage of up to 22,000 dinars. Technicians claim that the difference between both should be smaller".
"In the factory, the minimum wage is 6,800 dinars, while directors have a wage of up to 36,000 dinars".
"It was wide, confortable, old, with walls covered by apricot and creamy tapestry, with square tables surrounded by red chairs, and big lamps hanging from the ceiling and on the walls"
"Kruschev visited that same factory"
"It is considered to be a model commune, and we could see the extension of its executive organs".

Notes: Visita a cooperativa agicultora (Waiss le dice "Lazaro Polje")
Comment: "Traditionally men here emigrated to America and came back to settle and die. During the last war, it was destroyed. Today, life runs again through its uphill streets"

Notes: Tour with a boat around the lake
Comment: "Lazar Kolichevski showed us the town where he was sentenced to death when he was a hero of the resistance, straight out of the factory where was a skilled metal worker"

Site: A Look at the System of Local Self-Management
Comment: "That town in the Adriatic which the Italians still call Fiume"
"I saw a schoolteacher there (...) He said that before the war, there was only a primary school in the town. Now there are ten"

Site: Restaurant in the Outskirts of Zagreb
Comment: "We arrived, some boys where studying and laughing. When they saw me with Milos Zanko, from the University, they stood in silence. After we left, they started doing noises again. Zanko looked at them with a smile: youth is always youth, everywhere on this Earth"
"I met there an old Sephardic Jew. He told me he had spent 5 years in a concentration camp, and now life was for him happy and safe"
"Next to the oldest lake in Europe, it hold valuable artistic and architectonic relics"
"It kept its prosperity until the 1667 earthwquake. Nowadays, rebuilt and shining, it lives within the walls that remember its glorious past and keeps its traditions"
"A symbol of national poetry and history (...) There, Mestrovic built his Monument to the Unknown Soldier, with statues that represent the six federate republics"

"Tito is 63, but he seems much younger (...) One sees that he was not born to hesitate. That man had to give orders of life and death in the middle of his people's resistance against a terribly power invader. That man also knows where his country is going in the difficult times of today"

Site: Villa in the Outskirts of Split
Comment: "Established about 2,000 years ago, its narrow streets have still that typical look of the Middle Ages"
